title.narrative: MUNICIPAL SPI SYSTEMS

description.narrative: Integrated systems of social protection and inclusion developed in selected municipalities with the focus on the most vulnerable population, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Social Protection, Social Protection (Covid), Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020 relevant government institutions are strengthened to monitor child rights, reduce poverty and provide inclusive access to social protection services, including for the most marginalized children, especially Roma children and girls and boys with disabilities

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Integrated systems of social protection and inclusion developed in selected municipalities with the focus on the most vulnerablepopulation

description.narrative: The UNICEF-led SP component of the UN Joint Programme on DRR marked the successful completion of vulnerability risk assessments in 10 selected municipalities. The assessments represent a novel approach of combining social vulnerability data on children and vulnerable people, registered beneficiaries of Centres for Social Welfare, with geolocation of hazards and capacity analysis of CSWs and social service providers to enable the design of needs-based DRR measures. Formal partnerships were established with 5 municipalities to collaborate on the SP and inclusion local model and provide immediate support to COVID-19 affected families with children.*End yer assessment option as appropriate | Status:Met | As-of Date:18/01/2021
